questions.text: What is the finding shown in the picture?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a the main neonatal reflex

options.label: B
options.text: It is elicited once moro reflex disappear

options.label: C
options.text: Asymmetric tonic reflex disappears then roll over appears

questions.correct_answer: C. Asymmetric tonic reflex disappears then roll over appears
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Asymmetric tonic reflex disappears then roll over appears

questions.text: I am a 9 year old girl case of tubercular meningitis – during my case presentaiton doctor asked me – do you have a BCG scar, I said I don’t have the BCG scar. Why did the doctor asked me that question?

options.label: A
options.text: It was just a routine case presentation question

options.label: B
options.text: BCG vaccine prevents from pulmonary tuberculosis

options.label: C
options.text: BCG vaccine prevents from severe form of tuberculosis

questions.correct_answer: C. BCG vaccine prevents from severe form of tuberculosis
questions.explanation: Ans. C) BCG vaccine prevents from severe form of tuberculosis

questions.explanation: Ans. A) Hepatitis B immunoglobulin in one thigh + Hepatitis B vaccine in another thigh

questions.correct_answer: D. Growth retardation, mental changes & edema

questions.text: A 2-year-old child came with complaints of ear, eyes & face abnormalities. The image shown below resembles which triad?

A newborn baby came with a history that mother had history of fever with rash in 1 st and 2 nd trimester – Doctor said that the baby is coming under Gregg’s triad, what does the doctor mean?

options.label: A
options.text: Congenital heart disease ( PDA ) + Cataract + Deafness

options.label: B
options.text: Intra cranial diffuse calcifications + hydrocephalus + chorioretinitis

options.label: C
options.text: Cicatrical skin lesions + hypoplasia of lower limbs + mother with fever and rash history

questions.correct_answer: A. Congenital heart disease ( PDA ) + Cataract + Deafness
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Congenital heart disease ( PDA ) + Cataract + Deafness

questions.text: Risk of infections from the mother to the baby in congenital rubella is maximum before _____ weeks and uncommon after _____ weeks right?

options.label: A
options.text: Measles have non purulent conjunctivitis and Kawasaki also has non purulent conjunctivitis

options.label: B
options.text: Measles have purulent conjunctivitis and Kawasaki has purulent conjunctivitis

options.label: C
options.text: Measles have purulent conjunctivitis and Kawasaki has both purulent & non purulent conjunctivitis

options.label: D
options.text: Measles have purulent conjunctivitis and Kawasaki has non purulent conjunctivitis

questions.correct_answer: D. Measles have purulent conjunctivitis and Kawasaki has non purulent conjunctivitis
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Measles have purulent conjunctivitis and Kawasaki has non purulent conjunctivitis

questions.text: A 4-year-old child came with mid upper arm circumfernce of 10.5cm & was diagnosed with severe acute malnutrition. How do you treat SAM with dehydration without shock?

questions.explanation: Ans. C) ORS every 30 minutes for next 2 hours @ 5ml/kg

questions.text: The item shown below is used to feed newborn at what gestation?

A 32 week, 1400gms neonate is born to primigravida. The baby did not require resuscitation and show stable vitals. The baby was transferred to the NICU. How will you manage the feeding of the patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Start total enteral feeding & IV nutrition not required

options.label: B
options.text: Start IV nutrition with minimal enteral feeding

options.label: C
options.text: Start IV nutrition and introduce feeds on 2nd day of life

options.label: D
options.text: Start parenteral nutrition and institute oral feeding on 2nd day of life

questions.correct_answer: A. Start total enteral feeding & IV nutrition not required
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Start total enteral feeding & IV nutrition not required

They said it lasted for 18-20 minutes for which they gave intranasal midazolam at home and rushed to emergency department. As soon as they approached to casualty, patient got another episode of abnormal movement. In their family also patient’s mother had similar episodes when she was a child. Parents want to know whether this is simple febrile seizure or complex febrile seizure?

options.label: A
